strings.Value: "The Knurly Witch says she needs you. I'll handle it from here."
"The Wriggling Man sent us to take over for you."
"In the name of Shyka the Many, step away."

{n}In a clearing ahead, a satyr curses and hacks angrily at a stone pillar, trying to chip free a piece of a crown imbedded incongruously in its surface. Around him, massive purple worms roll and breach in the churned earth. He turns your direction.{/n} "What? Who are you? No, wait, I don't care — just get lost!"
"None of your business! Now get moving before I sick the worms on you!"
"And have you steal my glory? Not a chance! The Wriggling Man will make me his chief huntsman after this!" {n}He glares at you suspiciously.{/n}
{n}The satyr looks at you incredulously.{/n} "That skinbag thinks she can order me around? Tell your hag mistress that Faldrox the Huntsman bows to no one but the Wriggling Man! Worms — attack them!"
{n}The satyr looks at you incredulously.{/n} "You think I work for that skinbag?! I'd sooner cut off my horns! But you apparently lack my exquisite judge of character. Worms — attack them!"

{n}The satyr's expression crumples, his ears drooping.{/n} "But why? I was doing such a good job!" {n}He looks to the worms, then grins darkly.{/n} "Well, I won't stop you, then. But he can't fault me if the worms accidentally take a little nibble..."
"Liars! You think you can trick a satyr? You're the crone's toadies! My master's worms will devour your flesh!"

{n}The satyr looks puzzled.{/n} "{g|Shyka}Shyka{/g}? What do the Many have to do with this?" {n}He grins, showing sharp teeth, and waggles his eyebrows.{/n} "But nobody messes in the Wriggling Man's business. If the Lord of Time sent you, they must have known what I'd do to you..."
"Not as sorry as you'll be if you don't keep moving!"
